reviews.text: It‚Äôs been a long time since I dined in here so we decided to walk-in to have a breakfast. The ambience is lovely looking at the pastries and breads. Luckily, without reservations we are still able to dine in since it‚Äôs early in the morning. Had my breakfast meal with bread basket with oat flat white.

Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar is a well-loved dining destination located at the fringe of Orchard Road, housed in the historic Tanglin Post Office building. Since opening in 2012, it has built a strong reputation for its artisanal bakes, hearty comfort food, and cozy yet refined atmosphere. The space blends the feel of a classic European bakery with the vibe of a laid-back bistro ‚Äî making it a popular go-to for everything from brunch to dinner and drinks.

I visited for lunch and the place was bustling, clearly a favourite among regulars. From the seasonal spring menu, I had the Crab Omelette ‚Äî packed with jumbo lump crab meat tossed in aioli, jalape√±os, and chives, served over a cheese omelette with crispy homemade croutons. It was satisfying, but the standout for me was the Garlic Shokupan ‚Äî soft Japanese milk bread brushed with garlic butter, simple yet exceptionally good. The only drawback was that the restaurant seemed a bit understaffed during the lunch rush, which led to some wait time. Still, I‚Äôd rate it a 5 out of 5 ‚Äî excellent food, vibrant atmosphere, and a top pick for all-day dining in town.

Very good service and a solid menu. The pasta aglio olio was well-seasoned, though a tad oily. The main downside was the indoor acoustics making it quite noisy for conversation. If you prefer a quieter dining experience, the outdoor seating is a better option.

Awesome folks & food. Been visiting on & off for a awhile & never a disappointing moment. Pet friendly outdoors.
This time had all of their Easter Menu Specials, which hit all the right notes with tasty well balanced flavours.

Crew were so accomadating & indulged my request for a cappuccino w/ a shot of whiskey.

My new fav brunch drink created right there! I‚Äôll be back again soon!
Had the Hot Reuben sandwich and Poutine. Sandwich was 8/10, just missing pickles on the side. The Poutine is better shared as the portion is quite big‚Ä¶ plenty of ground beef but needs more gravy!
